title: Not even a chat restriction or a pre warning for ONE sentence
body:
14-day suspension has awarded for one sentence that I typed in a game. I've been on good behaviour for a very long time, 0:0 toxicity in pretty much  all my games during the past year. Other people type even more disgusting things but are given a chat restriction. I know I deserve a chat restriction (wouldn't affect me anyway because I don't even type in the game much) --> Merits my statement of "0:0 toxicity"  

I think a 14-day suspension is too harsh against my consistently good behaviour.

The link is my chat log (not logs)

Also, I've sent a ticket but I feel the reply was automated

I hear what you are saying but I dont agree that this is anything so serious. It is australian slang not meant in any way shape or form to be taken literally, in the same league as "go jump", "take a long walk off a short pier" or stuff like that.

I have zero tolerance for racism, homophobia, and other forms of hate speech.  I while I agree that "kill yourself" is a more serious thing to say, if you're triggered by someone saying "go jump" or "neck yourself", you have bigger problems in your life than me.

The problem I see is that, like any online competitive game, toxicity is rampant in LoL, and the mute button is an effective form of control riot has enabled players with - other players are under no pressure to tolerate bad words, and if players are triggered then they should mute the other player.

The real struggle i have is that I can be trying hard to play my best and a troll can be ruining a game - if I then tell the troll to neck themselves, they get off scott free and I get a 14 day suspension. That is a broken system imho - you get a ban for saying bad words that other players are empowered to mute, but the actual person wrecking the game gets nothing and can continue to wreck games, frustrate people who want to try and eventually turn these people away.

I used to think like you until it happened to me. I used to always think "oh fuck off you got banned after going through 3 punishment tiers so it is your own fault and  you deserve it".

Let me be absolutely clear here: I did not go through 3 punishment tiers. I went straight to tier 3.

In the interest of full disclosure I had a chat restriction toward the end of S5 (I was getting pretty salty with people trolling at season end) but there was >12m between that and my tier 3 so the impact of the first restriction would have decayed long before I got the 2nd.

genuine question, but do you take "fuck yourself" to literally mean that you have to find the flexibility to do it, or is it just a general insult? Serious question. What about "go jump". Does getting called a "loser" have any quantifiable basis or do you just see it as general banter? Neck yourself is slang, albeit for a fairly unsavoury act, but clearly not a serious request for someone to kill themselves. like I said, if someone on an internet game saying "neck yourself" is the trigger for an actual suicide, the person has issues that are well beyond the insults they receive that needs professional intervention and the avoidance of any triggers, such as online competitive games, news and current events or social media (its real - look it up) because the salt is absolutely there. 

What is the example that is set? Salt in competitive games is hardly surprising when our national heroes in Australia, the sports men and women, make a sport out of sledging and when the likes of connor mcgregor and floyd mayweather sledge the sh!t out of each other in public to increase PPV profits. While our professional sportsmen and women do this, it will always be an element of online gaming. Riot did the absolute right thing with a mute button because it empowers the player to determine who they have to listen to.

Yes the system is automated, but that is where player behaviour specialists come in. They weren't interested in the slightest and also took other stuff in the conversation out of context (someone on the other team said %%%% in place of "good" but it seemed like a deliberate insult - I queried the player because I find racism pretty offensive and it seems the auto text picked that up as something I had said. The player behaviour specialist even acknowledged this but still didnt revert the 14 day suspension through the appropriate punishment tiers).

Think what you like - I am not going to agree with you.
